The correct answer is A: Because linoleic acid has double bonds and fewer hydrogens, creating kinks and flexibility, whereas palmitic acid is fully saturated and packs tightly.
In the audio, the speaker mentions that fatty acids with double bonds flow more easily compared to those without. This is because the double bonds create kinks in the chain, which allows for more flexibility and ease of movement. Palmitic acid, on the other hand, is a saturated fatty acid with no double bonds, leading to a tighter packing and less mobility. The fact that the model shows palmitic acid and linoleic acid side by side also helps to convey this concept, as the difference in shape becomes apparent when comparing the two.
